website_summaries.verdict: The Mountain Trainer Mid GTX has qualities that made its expensive price worth every penny. It required minimal-to-no break-in period, was supportive and offered excellent traction. The rubber rand around the backpacking boot's upper received praise. Similarly, its comfort right out of the box and breathability were approved. The component that dissatisfied the minority was the outsole wearing out quickly.
pros: Salewa’s Mountain Trainer Mid GTX required a minimal-to-no break-in period, as claimed by many pleased users
Several wearers liked the rubber rand that runs around the boot
They noted that it protected them against screes and bumps
The steep price of this hiking boot surely paid off, according to satisfied purchasers
A considerable number of Salewa fans were flattered with the fit of the pair
The Mountain Trainer Mid GTX was supportive in almost every kind of trail, based on many consumer reviews
More than a handful appreciated the performance of the sole
It provided great traction on various ground conditions
The boots were indeed comfortable right out of the box, according to numerous hikers
An expert reviewer lauded the breathability of the pair
cons: A couple of wearers were disappointed with the outsole
They said that after a few months, it wore out quickly
One even said that it was so flat he can roll it in one hand

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Boots
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Boots as comfortable as Trainers but have the support of leather Boots. Wore them for a 8 mile walk straight out of the box without any need to break them in. They're light in weight have a superb lacing system which really holds your heel in place coupled with a great sole capable of use on any terrain. Toes are also well protected for use on rough terrain. I can really recommend these Boots.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Scotland

customer_reviews.title: As comfy as it gets.....
customer_reviews.text: Having owned many boots, meindl, mammut etc, can honestly say never managed to get things 100%, until now. Never have I put a pair of boots on that are more comfortable with such a perfect fit straight out of the box. Really look the business but more importantly the fit is perfect. I am a complete convert and hoping these stand the test of time, as all being well I will be converted to Salewa for life. Really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Birchall

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: Very good fit if you have shallow feet. Look great and very comfortable. Unfortunately the sole wears down fairly quickly, but I do wear them a lot. Unsure why there has been a recent price increase of 50% - I paid £120 and they're now over £180!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! Not comfy after a day in the lakes.
customer_reviews.text: Gutted I didn’t stick to Solomon boots. Worn once and coming down from helvellyn the soles of my feet were in pain. Never had that feeling with any footwear before now. These boots have very hard soles and I could them to be flat footed. I had such high hopes and feel a little stuck with them now I’ve worn them. Money wasted!! If anyone knows if I can get my money back or how to make them comfortable, please let me know. The look of the boot is great and hard wearing exterior are the only pluses.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Nash

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, though I would prefer slightly longer laces.
customer_reviews.text: I use these boots for both leisure pursuits and for (often very wet & muddy) charity events. Have used for long enough now to report that they are very comfortable and totally waterproof. This is a personal gripe, as I like to use a surgeon's knot at top of foot section & again at final ankle position. This leaves only just enough lace for a double bow. Personally would prefer a bit longer laces - others will be happy not having excess lace.
customer_reviews.author: Carl L

customer_reviews.title: Narrow on the instep but wider in the fore foot
customer_reviews.text: I already have the Salewa crow gtx (crampon compatible) and wanted a less stiff boot for hiking/walking. Salewa are a wider fit so the crows fit my feet, however the mountain trainer is far narrower on the instepand was uncomfortable for me. I had to return as a result but was a great shame as a nice looking boot and was a great fit for my wider foot at the ball of the foot. If they fit you then would be a good hiking/walking choice as well made boots.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great Design and Fit
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. I have the trainers as well. Both fit perfect straight out of the box. The orange extra long orange boot laces are proving difficult to match. Must find some Black laces so that I am a bit more low key. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Bede

customer_reviews.title: Break them in
customer_reviews.text: We holiday in the lakes every year and live in north Norfolk. So plenty of use with these boots. Totally waterproof. Changed the bright laces !! A little stiff to start but worn in fairly quickly. Would buy again 4th pair of salewa .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Comfy on all grounds, , had little leak but salewa replaced with a new boot
customer_reviews.author: philip easton

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots - much better than expected and at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Adam M Forster

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots!
customer_reviews.text: Cracking boot and lacing system. Fit like a glove with enough room for a couple of pairs of socks for the colder days. Ordered a 9.5, half a size up than my every day shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe for narrower feet and fast paced hiking/marches
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my feet, the shoe comes with a narrower toe box than usual and lacing which is very close to the style of approach or aggressive climbing shoes. Found them perfect for lightweight and fast matching as well as the boot itself has a perfect trainer like sole made of vibram.
customer_reviews.author: Seb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome set of boots
customer_reviews.text: Awesome set of boots kept me warm, comfortable and dry in Norway skiing and trekking etc very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Hastie

customer_reviews.title: Flexible Mountain Boot
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend these boots very comfy out the box and performed well in winter up Ben Cruachan in deep snow. Feet were dry and warm but never sweaty. Hopefully they last
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hay

customer_reviews.title: Should be listed as ‘second hand’
customer_reviews.text: Despite being listed as “new” they arrived scuffed and full of dog hairs. Also very concerned about the loose stitching on the tongue (as pictured)
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly with no break in required. Probably the most comfortable walking boots I've ever worn! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Top class
customer_reviews.text: Cracking boots. Comfortable and more robust than I was expecting. Perfect for summer or winter walking.
customer_reviews.author: Will Nettleton

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and grip
customer_reviews.text: Having Spent a week in the Pyrenees these boots provided superb grip and stability, highly recommend. No blisters if worn with thinner socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These boots are totally amazing comfy warm well protected and waterproof too.
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Good boots well made ,dazzling laces!
customer_reviews.text: Good for climbing and descending might not be so good on long distance trekking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: these boots not only look fantastic, but the fit and comfort added with the quality is exceptional. would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are mountaineering boots, not walking/hiking boots. Very ...
customer_reviews.text: These are mountaineering boots, not walking/hiking boots. Very stiff sole, could definitely be used with crampons, but will lack grip on slippery rock. Very well constructed and will take a pounding.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very good, relatively rigid hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable boots. They are on the rigid side for a hiking boot, so they are perfect for hiking on uneven terrain or for summer mountaineering. I've used them on snow too and they are ok for a few hours but they are not very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Salewa Mountain Goretex Boots
customer_reviews.text: It’s too large, send back to swap to small size, goretex. Update, new size arrive and fitting very weekly, waiting for next rainy day
customer_reviews.author: DenniS Szeremeta

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Substantial, robust hill walking/mountain boot. If you're looking for a lightweight boot for summer strolls you might be better to look elswhere.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Stamp

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Took a little longer to arrive than advertised but all in all I'm incredibly happy with them. They fit perfectly, incredibly comfy and looking forward to putting some miles on them
customer_reviews.author: joe myrie

product_meta.title: Salewa Men's Ms Mountain Trainer Mid Gore-tex Trekking & Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: The Mountain Trainer Mid GTX is a lightweight trekking boot for men, made from durable suede and abrasion-resistant textile with a waterproof and breathable GORE-TEX lining. The boot has been designed to meet the requirements of both ascent and descents in mixed and technical terrain. This is why the Mountain Trainer Mid GTX uses a new midsole with Bilight technology. Dual-layer cushioning and ergonomically shaped for good grip inside the shoe and reliable comfort even during long hikes. At the ankle area, the Flex Collar allows increased freedom of movement to the back and thus much comfort when descent, even with heavy luggage. The lightweight, firm Vibram wrapping thread Combi (wtc) outsole ensures a stable and natural running feel. The patented Salewa 3f system provides flexibility, heel support and a bubble-free fit right from the start. The GORE-TEX Performance Comfort lining ensures optimum weather protection and climate comfort.
feature_bullets: Suitable for: climbing, trekking, mountain hiking.
Recommended use: even on bad paths, climbing
Hiking shoe category: B trekking and hiking
Please note size selection: please refer to our size chart and instructions for choosing the right shoe size.
